alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 5:58PM MST until March 07 at 7:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Judith Basin County in central Montana... Central Cascade County in central Montana... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 557 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Judith Basin and southeastern Cascade county Cascade, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Visibility down to a quarter mile or less could result in hazardous driving conditions. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 246 and 263. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 61. Highway 89 between mile markers 33 and 71, and between mile markers 72 and 89. Locations impacted include... Cascade, Stanford, Belt, Hobson, Geyser, Neihart, Raynesford, Windham, Moccasin, Monarch, Eden, Sluice Boxes State Park, Ackley Lake State Park, Sapphire Village, Stockett, Tracy, Utica, Centerville, Tower Rock State Park and Armington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
